pageTitle: Patricia A. McKillip - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {2837=According to Fantasy Book Review, Patricia McKillip grew up in Oregon, Britain, and Germany and received a bachelor of arts in English in 1971 and a master of arts in 1973 from San Jose State University.[3] She has also lived in Roxbury, New York (in around 1999).[4], 3889=Patricia Anne McKillip (born February 29, 1948) is an American author of fantasy and science fiction novels, which have been winners of the World Fantasy Award, the Locus Award, and the Mythopoeic Award. In 2008, she was a recipient of the World Fantasy Award for Life Achievement.[1] She lives in Oregon and is married to David Lunde, a poet.[2]}
textBeforeTable: The Riddle-Master trilogy[edit] (Not all of these ISBNs are for first editions.) Bibliography[edit] 3 External links 2 References 1.5 Short Stories 1.4 Other works 1.3 Kyreol duology 1.2 The Cygnet duology 1.1 The Riddle-Master trilogy 1 Bibliography Contents Most of her recent novels feature cover paintings by Kinuko Y. Craft. According to Fantasy Book Review, Patricia McKillip grew up in Oregon, Britain, and Germany and received a bachelor of arts in English in 1971 and a master of arts in 1973 from San Jose State University.[3] She has also lived in Roxbury, New York (in around 1999).[4] Patricia Anne McKillip (born February 29, 1948) is an American author of fantasy and science fiction novels, which have been winners of the World Fantasy Award, the Locus Award, and the Mythopoeic Award. In 2008, she was a recipient of the World Fantasy Award
